dmca.title: [TP-C505510N] Copyright Violation
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern: Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA"). Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim. Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal. Legal Response Team THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC. -----Original Message----- From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] Posted At: Thursday, August 17, 2006 12:04 PM Posted To: Copyright Conversation: [TP-C505510N] Copyright Violation Subject: [TP-C505510N] Copyright Violation From: abuse@theplanet.com Subject: [TP-C505510N] Copyright Violation Reference: [TP-C505510N] For your review. Thank you, Policy Enforcement The Planet Internet Services, Inc. http://www.theplanet.com/legal/ ==== Original Message ==== 1. Copyright Violation Added by system at Thursday, Aug 17 2006 04:29 pm X-MailFrom: michaelmcd@gmail.com X-RcptTo: abuse@abacus.inside.theplanet.com Received: from [172.16.214.180] by [10.5.0.64] (abacus) for ; Thu Aug 17 16:16:42 2006 Return-path: Delivery-date: Thu, 17 Aug 2006 16:16:42 -0500 Received: from smtp02.theplanet.com ([70.87.6.111]) by mx01.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from michaelmcd@gmail.com) with esmtp (Exim) id 1GDp3C-000HvL-MZ for abuse@abacus.inside.theplanet.com; Thu, 17 Aug 2006 16:05:14 -0500 Received: from mail.theplanet.com ([216.185.111.52]) by smtp02.theplanet.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Thu, 17 Aug 2006 16:05:14 -0500 Received: from mx02.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.181] helo=mx02.filter.theplanet.com) by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from michaelmcd@gmail.com) with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 1GDp3C-0004Ks-5a for abuse@theplanet.com; Thu, 17 Aug 2006 16:05:14 -0500 Received: from nz-out-0102.google.com ([64.233.162.201]) by mx02.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from michaelmcd@gmail.com) with esmtp (Exim) id 1GDp3A-00037d-A1 for abuse@theplanet.com; Thu, 17 Aug 2006 16:05:12 -0500 Received: by nz-out-0102.google.com with SMTP id m7so416126nzf for ; Thu, 17 Aug 2006 14:05:11 -0700 (PDT) DomainKey-Signature: a=rsa-sha1; q=dns; c=nofws; s=beta; d=gmail.com; h=received:message-id:date:from:to:subject:cc:mime-version:content-type; b=JJ5UmEy9UQgF+qxXVitArORgKp7rEZqU7NFDbcCuGVgj6zRbD/JTmVX3Ol+WvHuAXaN2T4 +gDSrbRo84fPfRoTsEPlgC7r0XEcwTY0qF8xQ24+mpzk5U4qWOPMk4oAAvs+kf1hcMuvov++ CQ6YR5FdDmnQrm+Hj8GKGSbvkoZBU= Received: by 10.35.41.14 with SMTP id t14mr4284196pyj; Thu, 17 Aug 2006 14:03:40 -0700 (PDT) Received: by 10.35.85.14 with HTTP; Thu, 17 Aug 2006 14:03:40 -0700 (PDT) Message-ID: <63a747380608171403ja8fad0bk93389e79586ae060@mail.gmail.com> Date: Thu, 17 Aug 2006 17:03:40 -0400 From: "mike mcdonald" To: abuse@theplanet.com, postmaster@tagslammer.com Subject: Copyright Violation Cc: legal@theplanet.com MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="----=_Part_12259_10555704.1155848620406" Received-SPF: pass (mx02.filter.theplanet.com: domain of gmail.com designates 64.233.162.201 as permitted sender) client-ip=64.233.162.201; envelope-from=michaelmcd@gmail.com; helo=nz-out-0102.google.com; X-OriginalArrivalTime: 17 Aug 2006 21:05:14.0269 (UTC) FILETIME=[D5866CD0:01C6C240] (multipart/alternative) MIME element (text/plain) Hello, I have made multiple attempts to contact the owner/operator of: Tagslammer.com (70.85.225.213) Blogtorank.com (70.85.225.217) RankingForums.com (70.85.225.215) toranktools.com (70.85.225.196) Unfortunatly, my inquiries have been ignored to this point. At issue is the fact that these URLs are violating one or more terms of the DMCA by altering and/or misrepresenting copyright protected content. Specifically, the following URLs are (just a few) examples of content that has been scraped and had key elements of it's linking structure altered and or redirected to your client's network. bookmarks.tagslammer.com/?p=2621 bookmarks.tagslammer.com/?p=1661 bookmarks.tagslammer.com/?p=1868 This practice is in clear violation of your own AUP: http://theplanet.com/legal/index.html Specifically the following section: "*Intellectual Property Infringement Policy* Customers may not transmit, distribute, download, copy, cache, host, or otherwise store on a Server any information, data, material, or work that infringes the intellectual property rights of others. The Planet has the right to disable access to, or remove, infringing content to the extent required under any law or regulation, including the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998." Any and all works originating from WebProNews.com or the iEntry network of sites must either be restored to their oringal state (including any and all links contained within) or promptly removed. I appreciate your time and attention in this matter. Please feel free to contact me if you have any further questions. Regards, Michael McDonald Operations Manager iEntry, Inc. 859-514-2720 MIME element (text/html) Hello,

I have made multiple attempts to contact the owner/operator of:

Tagslammer.com    & nbsp;  (70.85.225.213)
Blogtorank.com         (70.85.225.217)
RankingForums.com  ; (70.85.225.215)
toranktools.com     ;     ( 70.85.225.196)

Unfortunatly, my inquiries have been ignored to this point.  At issue is the fact that these URLs are violating one or more terms of the DMCA by altering and/or misrepresenting copyright protected content.  Specifically, the following URLs are (just a few) examples of content that has been scraped and had key elements of it's linking structure altered and or redirected to your client's network.

bookmarks.tagslammer.com/ ?p=2621
bookmarks.tagslammer.com/?p=1661
bookmarks.tagslammer.com/ ?p=1868

This practice is in clear violation of your own AUP:

http://theplanet.com/legal/ index.html


Specifically the following section:

" Intellectual Property Infringement Policy

Customers may not transmit, distribute, download, copy, cache, host, or otherwise store on a Server any information, data, material, or work that infringes the intellectual property rights of others. The Planet has the right to disable access to, or remove, infringing content to the extent required under any law or regulation, including the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998."

Any and all works originating from WebProNews.com or the iEntry network of sites must either be restored to their oringal state (including any and all links contained within) or promptly removed.


I appreciate your time and attention in this matter.  Please feel free to contact me if you have any further questions.

Regards,

Michael McDonald
Operations Manager
iEntry, Inc.
859-514-2720


MIME element (text/plain)
